Teams of Japanese business executives and labor leaders,
sponsored by the Japan Productivity Center in cooperation
with the U.S. Government, have visited the United States to
exchange ideas on management, labor relations, technical
advances and many other useful subjects.
International trade is the key to higher living standards
around the world. We of the American business community
congratulate Japan on her remarkable gains in this field
and wish the third Japan International Trade Fair great
success,
ANNCRs
The Fair serves to dramatize Japan's continuing efforts to
raise living standards through industrial and agricultural
progress and improved trade-in short, her efforts to
achieve the same aim that is emblazoned on the American
exhibit at the Fair: "PROGRESS TO PLENTY."
These have been excerpts from John R. Snedaker’s address
